posts.post_content:
Darth, sometimes (ok most times) I have no clue what you are trying to say.....
  
   
Comet storm is clearly better than fireball in that it doesnt have to split X damage equally between Y targets. Then again its a mythic and this is uncommon, but still. Comet storm is undeniably better than fireball. I'd like to see your argument otherwise. Lets do some math:
  
   
Lets say 5 5/5's and 1 opponent. You want to kill the 5/5s and deal dmg to opponent:
  
   
With comet storm it would be 5 for X, 2R, and 5 to kick it for 5 extra targets. Total 12 mana, for 30 damage done.
  
   
With Fireball, it would be 5 mana for the "kicker", only 1 R, but since the damage is split evenly you'd need X to be 30. Total 36 mana.
  
   
Granted that is an extreme example, but still it clealy illustrates the differnce between the two spells in their power level.

I like how, because it's an {X}{R} spell, it has nearly as much potential as every other {X}{R} spell, but when you pick this over [Comet Storm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Comet Storm), you can claim you are sacrificing a lot of power to be the Cool Guy who plays so-called "Classics"- when, actually, an X is still an X and I'm not sold that this is DISTINCTLY weaker than [Comet Storm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Comet Storm) or [Shivan Meteor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shivan Meteor). When it goes boom for X, it's going to go boom for X, and that's going to be a big threat to someone even if it's the 'old, decrepit Alpha version'. The only things that really matter to me about Red Bombs are:   
  
1) is it a Permanent-Destroyer, or a Damage Dealer?  
2) Can it Hit Players if it's Damage?  
3) Is it Counterable or not?   
  
that flowchart will show that rather a lot of cards are virtually equivalent to each other, and that same flowchart will just about produce the 1-drop 3 damagers that are the stars of 2-player RDW decks.
